tagger.tagNote: 2nd Pass; Josh Rothman did first pass.

div.head: French, American and English Young Ladies
div.summary: Comparison of the courting and marriage practices of France, England, and the United States, reflecting especially on the position of women in these nations.

div.head: The Scotch-Irish
div.summary: Excerpts of speech of Bolivar Christian to the alumni of Washington College, in which he made some observations about the "character and habits" of the Scotch-Irish settlers of the Valley of Virginia.

page.pageNote: Poetry, stories about Napoleon and China, poem for Bell by Finley Johnson (column 7).

div.head: How to Vote
div.summary: Spectator calls on voters to put aside party considerations and vote on the principle of holding the Union together. The Spectator believes that following this principle leads one logically to a vote for Bell and the Constitutional Unionists, who have a better chance at victory than Douglas.

div.head: The Ashland Speech
div.summary: Report of a speech delivered by Breckinridge at Ashland. Spectator is skeptical of Breckinridge's rejection of disunion and claims that his candidacy could lead to just that.

div.head: Commissioners of Election
div.summary: List of state commissioners for the Presidential election, appointed by the Governor.
Report of Bell/Everett rallies in Richmond and Petersburg.

div.head: Incendiary Plot--Startling Discovery
div.summary: Report of a planned insurrection by blacks and whites discovered near Selma, Alabama.

div.head: Col. Baldwin's Speech
div.summary: Report of Col. Baldwin's speech to a Bell/Everett rally in Richmond.

div.head: Bell and Everett Club in Augusta County
div.trailer: William Crawford, Chairman; C.K. Hyde, Secretary
div.summary: Report of the first meeting of the Union Party club, held at the Academy in Mt. Sidney on September 8.

div.head: For the Spectator
div.trailer: S.B. Finley, President; William C. Berry, Secretary
div.summary: Report of the meeting of a Union Party club, held at New Hope on September 8.

div.head: Union Meeting
div.trailer: John Hamilton, President; James Watson, Secretary
div.summary: Report of a meeting held in Barterbrook on September 1 to raise a Bell/Everett pole and start a Bell/Everett club.

div.head: For the Spectator
div.summary: Report of the Sunday School celebration for all the schools on the Mt. Sidney circuit, held at New Hope on September 7.

div.head: A Curious Ceremony
div.summary: Report of a ceremony held at the raising of a Lincoln pole in Martinsville, Ohio.

page.pageNote: Short political articles scattered on page, some from other papers, some excerpts of political speeches, etc. Columns 6-7 are ads.

div.summary: Story about men fined for giving women unsolicited kisses, one in New York and one in Canada.

div.head: Died
div.summary: Died on September 8 in the county.

div.head: Sale of Delinquent Lands
div.summary: List of land and town lots (and their owners) being sold for non-payment of taxes. This is not the first issue in which this list appears--it appears weekly from mid-August through late September.

page.pageNote: Mostly ads, land sales, auctions, etc.
